metadata.title: How to Add YouTube Info Cards 2025: Interactive Cards Guide
metadata.description: Add info cards to YouTube videos. Interactive elements that boost engagement.

hero.headline: How to Add YouTube Info Cards
hero.subheadline: Interactive prompts in your videos. Drive engagement where it matters.

sections.content: Info cards are interactive elements that appear during your video—promoting other videos, playlists, channels, or external links. Unlike end screens that only work in the final seconds, cards can appear anywhere in your video. Use them strategically to keep viewers in your content ecosystem.

content.title: Video Card
content.description: Link to specific video. Most commonly used.

content.title: Relevant Moments
content.description: When you mention related content, add card.

content.title: Retention Dips
content.description: Place before drop-off points to redirect.

content.title: Verbal Callouts
content.description: Mention the card: 'Check out the card above.'

content.title: Content References
content.description: Link when discussing other videos or resources.

sections.title: Card Best Practices
content: Cards appear as 'i' icon, then expand

faq.question: Maximum cards per video?
faq.answer: YouTube allows 5 cards per video. Use them strategically at relevant moments. Too many feels spammy and reduces effectiveness.

faq.question: Do cards work on all devices?
faq.answer: Yes, but appearance varies. Desktop shows 'i' icon. Mobile shows as tappable overlay. Test on both platforms to understand experience.

faq.question: Cards vs end screens?
faq.answer: Both valuable, different uses. Cards work throughout video for timely suggestions. End screens are final call-to-action. Use both strategically.

faq.question: Can I add external links?
faq.answer: Only with YouTube Partner Program membership. Links must go to approved sites. Most creators link to their own website or merchandise.
